node.title: Terry McAuliffe concedes to Glenn Youngkin, a Republican financier, in the Virginia governor’s race.
node.alt: With former President Donald J. Trump out of office, former Gov. Terry McAuliffe struggled to generate enthusiasm among liberals at a moment when conservatives are energized in opposition to President Biden.
node.description: The Democrat’s defeat in his bid to return to the governor’s office came a year after Joseph R. Biden Jr. carried Virginia by 10 points.
node.content: ["Former Gov. Terry McAuliffe, the Democratic candidate for governor in Virginia, conceded on Wednesday morning to his Republican opponent, the businessman Glenn Youngkin, as the Republican Party claimed the state\u2019s governorship for the first time in more than a decade.", "\u201cWhile last night we came up short, I am proud that we spent this campaign fighting for the values we so deeply believe in,\u201d Mr. McAuliffe said in a statement.", "He added, \u201cWhile there will be setbacks along the way, I am confident that the long-term path of Virginia is toward inclusion, openness and tolerance for all.\u201d", "With his victory, Mr. Youngkin, 54, presented his party with a formula for how to exploit President Biden\u2019s vulnerabilities and evade the shadow of Donald J. Trump in Democratic-leaning states. A wealthy former private equity executive making his first run for office, he elevated education and taxes while projecting a suburban-dad demeanor to demonstrate he was different from Mr. Trump without saying so outright.", "With Mr. Trump out of office, Mr. McAuliffe struggled to generate enthusiasm among liberals at a moment when conservatives are energized in opposition to Mr. Biden.", "The Associated Press called the race for Mr. Youngkin shortly after 12:30 a.m. Wednesday morning, hours after the polls closed on Tuesday night.", "Mr. Youngkin\u2019s surprise victory in Virginia represents the starkest warning yet that Democrats are in danger. It was likely to prompt additional congressional retirements, intensify the intraparty tug of war over Mr. Biden\u2019s agenda and fuel fears that a midterm electoral wave and Mr. Trump\u2019s return as a candidate are all but inevitable.", "\u201cThe MAGA movement is bigger and stronger than ever before,\u201d Mr. Trump said in a statement Tuesday night."]
